item.title: Software Estimation Deniers: the Flat-Earthers of Project Management
item.description: Another day, another Hacker News post complaining about estimation in software build projects. These articles and comment sections should come with a trigger warning for armchair speculation. Project management and time estimation are fields of serious research. Drawing conclusions from your personal experience, with no idea what the research says, is as silly as writing your experience that the world is obviously flat. Estimation is actually well understood in academic project management.

item.title: 5 Project Manager Comments That Out You as an Amateur
item.description: A lot of the project managers you’ll meet in technical consulting are new. That’s OK! The number of developers - and correspondingly, their project managers - is growing exponentially from year to year. Even if we could assign everyone a mentor with at least a year of experience, there wouldn’t be enough mentors to go around. A lot of people are learning as they go, and land in a role because someone thinks they have an aptitude.
